group_1.textLeft: Now then, let's get started.
For the sake of restoring people's trust in@Magical Girls.
Let's go bring salvation to our friends in Yukuni@City who have become Witches.

group_1.textRight: It seems like the last broadcast was a success, then.

group_1.textLeft: Were many people secretly opposed to the@Eradication Faction's methods?
Well then, someone's third party opinion really@could make a difference after all.
Little by little, the perception of Magical Girls@amongst the student body seems to be improving.

group_1.textRight: The rise in incidents and accidents had been a@hot topic on local TV programs.
Could this steady decline we're now seeing@be attributed to the Magical Girls?

group_1.textLeft: Yes, I think so.
It looks like the remaining six Magical Girls in@Yukuni City are taking down the Witches.

group_1.textRight: A sudden decrease like this must mean there@were so many Witches...
It was said on the news that most of the victims@were teenagers.

group_1.textLeft: If you include the children who became Witches,@there may be prolific victims...
Still, I've heard that if public safety improves, we'll@be able to reconcile with the Eradication Faction.
This is the crucial moment those Magical Girls@and I have been waiting for.
There are going to be people who will spread the@truth of Magical Girls and stand up for them.
I'm attempting to accomplish what hasn't been@managed since antiquity...

group_1.narration: If we can succeed, then we can put an end to@the wanton cruelty propagating throughout history.
The utterly despair-inducing hypothesis I've@long been burdened with might finally disappear...

group_1.textLeft: Grief Seeds purify Soul Gems...
This was left behind by a Magical Girl who fought@to help someone.
It might be her last act of kindness...

group_1.textRight: When thinking about it like that, I'm glad she@dropped a Grief Seed.
She's not just spreading curses.
She was doing her part to save us...

group_1.textLeft: The Witch we just defeated was a childhood@friend of yours, right...?

group_1.textRight: Yeah...
She was a close friend, supportive and cooperative@even when we fought over a shared wish.

group_1.textLeft: I've heard a little of the story before,
but I haven't heard about anyone fighting.

group_1.textRight: Well, we both wished to go out with someone@we had a crush on.
If that was all it was, we could've just laughed@together about how similar we were.
But it turned out that the person I liked was the@same person she did...
Because I wished after she did, it ended up@basically taking her wish away from her.
Even though neither of us had known who the@other person liked,
when we found out, we got into a huge fight.

group_1.textLeft: So that's what happened...
Were you able to go back to being good friends@again, like before...?

group_1.textRight: I ended up dumping the person we liked in order@to prioritize our friendship instead.

group_1.textLeft: Ah...

group_1.textRight: I wondered what the point of being a Magical@Girl even was.
But as long as we were together, we could get@along and do our best to fight Witches.
Actually, we had been saying that it would be nice@if everyone knew who we were,
and we could get a little reward for it.

group_1.textLeft: I'm sorry about that...
It's likely our fault that Magical Girls ended up@being misunderstood...

group_1.textRight: We both shared the same hope.
We talked about Magical Girls to a friend we@thought we could trust.
It's not your fault, Sasha.@Everyone still alive is a fellow companion.

group_1.textLeft: ...Let's continue to make the hopes we dreamed@of come true.
To create a world where people understand@Magical Girls
and where people can be kind to each other.

group_1.textRight: Yeah, that's what I promised my friend, even if@she's now a Witch.
